DataElement.preferredName: Pancreatic Mucinous-Cystic Neoplasm Pathologic Confirmed Diagnosis Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not a diagnosis of mucinous cystic neoplasm (MCN) was confirmed in the pathology report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pancreatic Mucinous-Cystic Neoplasm Pathologic Confirmed Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A non-invasive or invasive cystic epithelial neoplasm that affects almost exclusively females.  It is characterized by the presence of columnar mucin-producing epithelial cells and ovarian-type stroma formation._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._Confirmed; having been established or verified._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A non-invasive or invasive cystic epithelial neoplasm that affects almost exclusively females.  It is characterized by the presence of columnar mucin-producing epithelial cells and ovarian-type stroma formation.

Concepts.definition: A non-invasive or invasive cystic epithelial neoplasm that affects almost exclusively females.  It is characterized by the presence of columnar mucin-producing epithelial cells and ovarian-type stroma formation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
